definition: to enroll in the Communist Youth League
to enter/to go into/to join/to become a member of/to confirm or agree with/abbr. for 入聲|入声[ru4 sheng1]
round/lump/ball/to roll into a ball/to gather/regiment/group/society/classifier for a lump or a soft mass: wad (of paper), ball (of wool), cloud (of smoke)

sentences.english: Jack, a classmate of mine, has joined the League.
sentences.chinese: 傑克，我的一個同學，已經入團了。

sentences.english: Do you still remember the day when you joined the League?
sentences.chinese: 你還記得你入團的那一天嗎？

sentences.english: On Youth Day, I joined the League. (
He will forever remember the day that he joined the League on.
sentences.chinese: 我將永遠不會忘記我入團的那一天。

sentences.english: He joined the League three years ago.
sentences.chinese: 三年前入團，joined爲短暫行爲。
我永遠也忘不了我入團的那一天。

sentences.english: Well do I remember the day when I joined the League.
sentences.chinese: 我對入團的那一天還記憶猶新。

sentences.english: When I still remember the day I met him.
sentences.chinese: 我仍然記得入團的那一天。

definition: to spike the ball (volleyball etc)/to smash (tennis etc)
lit. the river that divides Chu and Han/fig. a line that divides rival territories/the mid-line between sides on a Chinese chessboard
lit. to assess the head and discuss the feet (idiom); minute criticism of a woman's appearance/fig. to find fault in minor details/nitpicking/overcritical
to refute/to demolish (an argument, theory etc)
lit. to draw a gourd from the model (idiom)/fig. to copy sth mechanically without attempt at originality
When you enter a country, follow the local customs (idiom); do as the natives do/When in Rome, do as the Romans do
